summary: Foreign investments in U.S. companies can benefit the economy, but could pose risks to national security. The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) reviews certain foreign acquisitions and mergers and can work with the parties involved to mitigate national security risks or block transactions. The committee reviewed over 50% more transactions in 2016 than in 2011. We recommended assessing staffing needs to...
title: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States: Treasury Should Coordinate Assessments of Resources Needed to Address Increased Workload
